full_text: Data Scientist, Integrate, United States, Remote, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 2 weeks ago, Easy Apply
details:
Company Overview:
Integrate is the leader in Precision Demand Marketing, an emerging category to help B2B marketers develop and deliver an omnichannel demand strategy, convert leads to revenue and drive marketing ROI.

Over the past decade, Integrate has evolved from solving complex challenges across each demand generation channel to powering account-based, buyer-driven omnichannel experiences. Integrate’s Demand Acceleration Platform helps marketers orchestrate connected buying experiences that drive qualified conversations at scale, simplify ABM management, and accelerate revenue generation.

We have been recognized as a "Best Places to Work" every year since 2014 and have offices in Phoenix, AZ, Hopkinton, MA, Birmingham, AL, London, UK, and now in Chennai, India! However, we are a remote-first type company where you will find Integrators across the globe!

At Integrate, we are a technology company that leads with a technology-first mentality. We use cutting-edge tools and take pride in staying ahead of the curve. Therefore, it is essential that our engineering teams feel that they are doing what they are passionate about and expand their skills and experience levels.

Our Mission:
To connect everything - data, channels, tech, and team members - to create intelligent buyer and account journeys, and deliver Precision Demand Marketing at scale.

Why us?
From each contributor, each level of management, and founder and CEO, Jeremy Bloom, Integrate is an organization of integrity, talent, passion, and vision. Our track record of growth, customer success, and an executive commitment to leading in product discovery, innovation, and user experience, has us positioned for revolutionary innovation in enterprise software.

Integrate's Annual Growth Snapshot:
Founded: 2010
Funding: $100m+ raised from leading MarTech investors, along with a partnership/acquisition by Audax Private Equity in December 2021
Customers: Enterprise and high-growth companies, including Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, Dell, Adobe, Akamai, VMware, RedHat, Pluralsight, Splunk, etc.
Global offices: Phoenix, Boston, Birmingham, London, San Fransico, Denver, and Chennai India
Employees: ~380
Revenue Growth: 40% YoY
DAP Ecosystem: 1000’s of event and trade shows; marketplace of 150+ publishers; 1000’s publications; 700M social subscribers; 2M+ web and mobile insights. This ecosystem includes a growing group of partners, including companies such as Bombora, Digital Pi, JustGlobal, LinkedIn, ON24, and Inverta.

The Role:
Integrate’s data is treated as a critical corporate asset and is seen as a competitive advantage in our business.

We’re looking for a mid-level, tenured Data Scientist with a passion for technology and innovation, and the ability to organize the building and shipping of data science and analytics-enabled products at scale. We’re looking for help understanding our data, optimizing existing processes, and making predictions to improve the product and experience.

Our team develops and evaluates AI-powered systems that optimize our client's experiences. Our ideal candidate will be able to apply rigorous statistical techniques to evaluate the impact of new and existing systems as well as assist in identifying new opportunities for development.

Responsibilities:
Participate in collaborative analytics code design and delivery process with Product teams, Engineering teams, and peers.
Educate Engineering and Integrate Data Science possibilities, fundamentals, and use cases.
Create, use and execute Data Science workflow for data science production implementation.
Develop functional prototypes of data products incorporating analytics, visualization, and machine learning.
Participate in cross-functional projects.
Build models, dashboards, and tools using technical knowledge in machine learning, statistical modeling, probability and decision theory, and other quantitative techniques.
Understand the business use cases and customer value behind large sets of data and develop meaningful analytic solutions.
Utilize SQL and other programmatic code (Scala, Python, etc.) for analyzing data and building statistical models to solve specific business problems.
Improve upon existing methodologies by developing new data sources, testing model enhancements, and fine-tuning model parameters.
Work alongside Data Engineers and Software Engineers for data ingestion and app deployment.
Mentoring engineers and team members on best practices and Data Science strategy at Integrate.

Requirements:
Advanced degree (Masters preferred) in Statistics, Computer Science, or related technical/scientific field.
2+ years in a professional Data Science development role is preferred
Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python, and data processing workflow
Transactional DB (MongoDB, Postgres), Spark/Scala, MLFlow, and AWS experience.
Strong communication and data presentation skills.
Leadership skillsets to mentor and train junior team members and stakeholders.

Additional Desirable Skills/ Experience:
Technology agnostic mindset with a proven experience in identifying and learning new systems, languages, and data frameworks.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Enthusiastic, positive attitude, yet disciplined and detailed-oriented
Familiar with Agile methodology environments, including both SCRUM and Kanban.

***At this time, we are unable to sponsor foreign-working visas, including all H and F-type visas. Applicants MUST be generally located in the United States.***

full_text: Site Reliability Engineer- (multiple levels), Salesforce, Los Angeles, CA, Remote, Hide job, 19 company alumni work here, 5 days ago, 18 applicants
details:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category Products and Technology Job Details

Job Description

Site Reliability Engineer - All Levels - (Senior/Lead/Principal) (Multiple Locations)

Job Details

Note: By applying to the Site Reliability Engineer posting, recruiters and hiring managers across the organization hiring Site Reliability Engineers will review your resume. Our goal is for you to apply once and have your resume reviewed by multiple hiring teams.

Are you an upcoming or recent graduate (within the past 2.5 years)? Please check out our FutureForce program at www.salesforce.com/futureforce . We appreciate your interest but we are seeking industry experienced engineers.

Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.

About Salesforce Tech And Product Engineering

Our Tech and Product team is tasked with innovating and maintaining a massive distributed systems engineering platform that ships hundreds of features to production for tens of millions of users across all industries every day. Our users count on our platform to be highly reliable, lightning fast, supremely secure, and to preserve all of their customizations and integrations every time we ship. Our platform is deeply customizable to meet the differing demands of our vast user base, creating an exciting environment filled with complex challenges for our hundreds of agile engineering teams every day.

Check out our "We are Salesforce Engineering" video

We are Salesforce Engineering

Departmental Description

Salesforce is seeking an engineering candidate to join the Site Reliability organization in one of our US locations. Working closely with counterparts in the Infrastructure and R&D organizations, this organization provides a global team of engineers monitoring cloud service availability and ready to swiftly repair any service-impacting issues. Seven days a week, 24 hours a day, in a follow-the-sun model, the Site Reliability team keeps the Salesforce cloud and our customers protected. As a member of the Site Reliability team, you will be tasked with detecting and resolving incidents within minutes. This objective is met by monitoring the services, reacting to problems, and proactively addressing issues before they affect performance or availability.

Position Description

When not fighting fires, the team is responsible for fire prevention through monitoring, automation, self-healing and resiliency initiatives, destructive testing, and game day exercises. The incumbent in this role would demonstrate a strong focus on tactical operations, as well as large-scale production engineering and orchestration.
Keep the customer-facing services available at top performance by maintaining the constant health of the supporting systems.
Incident management - Act in key response roles during major incidents e.g. Sev0, Sev1. Also, participate in the technical review of the incident for problem management
Problem Management - populate in participate in (Root Cause Analyses (RCAs) and hand them off to the Global Solutions team
Ensuring that work carried out by the Site Reliability team is performed in such a way as to align with the company’s internal compliance policy and directives
Being available to discuss and resolve technical issues and escalations with other technical staff as the need arises
Work with and lead other members of the team in staying on top of key industry innovation and technology, and assist in team development growth
Identifying work opportunities and preparing or assisting with the preparation of technical proposals as the need arises
Ability to operate in the fast paced environment and troubleshoot complex issues quickly successfully handle multiple priorities
Work to automate detection and resolution of recurring issues in the production environment
Basic Requirements
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field OR equivalent experience
Systems engineering experience in enterprise scale internet service engineering or related role
Expertise in TCP/IP related technologies (networking protocols, network programming, etc.)
Expertise in CLI enterprise support of Unix variants (Linux/Solaris/BSD) as well as strong Linux/UNIX knowledge with significant exposure to Red Hat Enterprise Linux and Solaris
Experience with monitoring implementations and administration
Strong communication skills (Written and Oral)
Past experience in Incident Management and ITIL service operations
Experience in working in a 24/7 team managing large data centers
Participate in the team’s on-call rotation to address complex problems in real-time and keep services operational and highly available
Preferred Qualifications
Masters in Computer Science
Perl/Python/BASH scripting experience
Prior Chef/Puppet or automated deployment experience
Experience in maintaining a monitoring and alert systems
Experience troubleshooting relational databases and distributed platforms
Experience in maintaining Java applications
Experience in Docker orchestration and management.
Experience with Kubernetes
Hands on experience configuring and managing AWS (Amazon Web Services), using the CLI/SDKs
Experience handling systems monitoring and alerts.
Experience with JVM optimization and Java server technologies like Tomcat or Jetty
Benefits & Perks

We have a public-facing website salesforcebenefits.com that explains our various benefits, including wellbeing reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more. Visit for the full breakdown!

Open to Fully Remote, Flex (1-3 days/week in the office), or Office-Based (4-5 days/week in office)

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .

Salesforce welcomes all.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

full_text: Data Scientist, Luma Health, San Francisco, CA, 401(k) benefit, Hide job, 2 alumni work here, 1 month ago
details:
WE'RE LUMA HEALTH.

Needing healthcare can be hard — getting care shouldn't be.

We built Luma Health because we are all patients. We believe it should be easy to see and connect with our doctor. To get the care we need, when we need it.

So, we've created solutions to fix this problem. Our technology makes messaging easier, scheduling appointments more efficient, and it modernizes care delivery from beginning to end.

What YOU will do at Luma Health

Luma Health is looking for a Data Scientist to join our Analytics team. Specifically, that means data analysis, report building, market analysis, and product reporting.

We are looking for an individual familiar with contemporary software development and processes and experience with commercial data analysis, synthesis, and presentation. We're interested in someone with both experience in and a passion for joining a small team of talented professionals on simultaneous internal projects from inception through success while also rolling up his or her sleeves and taking on responsibility for project delivery.This role calls for incredible versatility. You have to balance execution, communication, and analytics in a fast-paced, often messy data environment.

While no day at Luma is the same, your tasks will be fluid and include things like:
Establish a cadence of regular grooming of the team's backlog and turn the agile crank- prioritize, scope, commit, deliver
Institute and oversee self-QA and review processes for the team as an internal analytics shop
Bridge, integrate, and extract meaning from different sources of business data - Product (Redshift, Postgres, MongoDB), Salesforce, and 3rd party feeds and data lakes
Understand our data and ensure soundness for both internal reporting and customer consumption
Define and build dashboards for key product performance metrics and on new initiatives
Highlight strategic insights from the data to drive product and go-to-market strategy
Use SQL, Python (and at times, R if you know it) to develop consistent and coherent reports

Who You are:
Hold a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university with an analytical degree
4 years working in data-intensive analytical roles
2 years experience working in the healthcare industry
Be an expert at writing SQL queries to pull reporting data, annotating for clarity, and optimizing for elegance with ease
Be conversational with Python for analyses, visualizations and data transformation
Rapidly run ad hoc reports and organize output effectively in spreadsheets and presentations
Understand different databases and how to efficiently join data across systems
Communicate (written and verbal) complex findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audience
Love to think on your feet and have an inquisitive nature
Thrive in a fast-paced startup environment
Be a team player

We Take Care of You!
Competitive Health Benefits: Luma Health covers 99% of the employee and 85% of the dependent premium costs.
Work Life Balance
Flexible Time Off
Wellness Programs
Discounted Perks
401(k) and Company Equity

Luma Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We believe in order to thrive, businesses need a diverse team and leadership. We welcome every race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Everyone is welcome here.

Come join us if you want to make a difference in health care.

Note: we have been made aware of individuals fraudulently claiming to represent Luma Health recruiting. Please note that you will never be asked to submit payment or share financial information to participate in our interview process. All emails from Luma Health will come from "@lumahealth.io" email addresses. Any emails from other email addresses are scams. If you suspect that you've been contacted by a scammer, we recommend you cease all communication with the scammer and contact the FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you'd like to verify the legitimacy of an email you've received from Luma Health recruiting, forward it to careers@lumahealth.io.

full_text: Data Scientist - Remote, PatientPoint®, United States, Remote, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 5 days ago
details:
Job Title: Data Scientist, Advanced Analytics

Location: Cincinnati, OH (preferred) or Remote with Eastern time zone hours

Full-time, exempt

Job Summary:

The Advanced Analytics team at PatientPoint works on business problems across the enterprise, such as customer attrition, operations, marketing, revenue, and optimization.

As a Data Scientist, you will work on these problems by gathering data, summarizing, analyzing, and visualizing to help end-users make meaningful business decisions. In addition, you will execute statistical analysis of large datasets using Python, SQL and R.

What You Will Do
The Data Scientist performs statistical analysis, consulting, interpretation and selects methodologies to be used in advanced analytics. This is a critical role serving internal and external customers by applying analytical thinking and delivering actionable insights.
Provides leadership in data science and analytics in the development of current or future products, technologies or services, for internal business questions and external facing case study analysis.
This person will be creating software tools, programs and scripts to help others leverage their work, extract data and find actionable insights daily on an ongoing routine basis.
Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources.
This person will be designing and executing statistical analysis to answer key business questions, address objectives and shape business policy. In other analysis, this person will create statistical models to be used on an ongoing basis for scoring new target leads, anomaly detection and expected values obtained via time series forecasting.
Applies artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques to solve complex questions or fuel new business opportunities


What We Need:
Bachelor's required, Masters preferred. Applied Statistics, Computer Science, business analytics or a related field preferred.
Minimum 4 years, 6+ years preferred. Only direct and hands-on work-related experience with creating and using analytics to change business policy apply to this requirement. Candidates will be asked to provide examples from their experience with using analytics to create actionable insights.
Strong statistical modeling skills. The candidate will have advanced knowledge of machine learning and predictive modeling techniques. Experience with and know when to apply regression analysis, A/B testing, power analysis, anomaly detection, model validation and selection, building of ensemble models, network analysis, simulation, conducting inferential analysis with spatial and time series data, nearest neighbor, deep learning methods, etc.
Knowledge and demonstrated ability through experience with both the R programming language and Python programming language required and at scale with large data sets. Candidates will be asked to provide several examples of each during the interview process or complete a case study analysis to validate these skills.
Working knowledge of the SQL programming language including experience creating complex SQL queries, data views and functions.
In addition to the specific technology mentioned above, this role is expected to discover, learn, develop, and implement solutions in new or emerging statistical methodologies and leverage new technologies as necessary.

Desired Qualifications
Professional experience in healthcare and digital advertising industries
Experience with Snowflake, AWS SageMaker
Experience with Salesforce, including Einstein Analytics
Experience with geospatial analysis

What You Will Need To Succeed
Critical thinking with the ability to identify and solve problems in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to break down complex business and technical problems into opportunities for analytical study.
Strong interpersonal, communication and consulting skills. Ability to establish and maintain successful cross functional relationships and collaborate closely with multiple teams.
Collaboration experience with developers, program managers, and product managers in an open, creative environment.
Focused and results oriented: consistent ability to deliver and by deadline.
“Can do” attitude in an environment of entrepreneurship and opportunity, with changing priorities.

What We Offer

We know you bring your whole self to work every day. That is why we are committed to providing modernized benefits and cultural perks to our teammates. We offer: competitive compensation, comprehensive and affordable benefits, flex time off to rest and charge, where applicable, a hybrid work model, mental & emotional wellness resources and coaching, 401K and more.

About PatientPoint

PatientPoint ® is the patient engagement platform more providers trust. Our innovative, tech-enabled solutions create more effective doctor-patient interactions and deliver high value for patients, providers and healthcare sponsors. Through our nearly 140k unique healthcare provider relationships, PatientPoint’s solutions impact roughly 750 million patient visits each year, further advancing our mission of making every doctor-patient engagement better ® . Learn more at patientpoint.com .

PatientPoint requires its employees to be fully vaccinated (as defined by the CDC) against COVID-19, where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on their qualifying disability/medical condition, or sincerely held religious beliefs that prevent them from being vaccinated.

Employer is EOE/M/F/D/V

full_text: Software Engineer, Data Science, Forward, San Francisco, CA, $90K/yr - $150K/yr (LinkedIn est.), Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 1 week ago, 22 applicants
details:
Forward is on a bold mission to make high quality healthcare available to a billion people across the globe. We’re building the world’s most advanced healthcare platform from the ground up, combining hardware, software and doctors under one roof. We are scaling our engineering team and looking for world-class engineers with experience and expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. As an early member of our engineering team, you’ll have a key role in building the future of healthcare from first principles.

Forward was founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Founder's Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital, Eric Schmidt (Google/Alphabet Chairman), Marc Benioff (Salesforce Founder), Joe Lonsdale (Palantir Founder), Joshua Kushner (Oscar co-Founder) and Garrett Camp (Uber co-Founder).

You can read our story here or check out a quick YouTube video .

What You'll Do
Develop algorithms and design highly scalable software solutions for real world problems using data science and machine learning.
Collaborate with domain experts in fields like AI and NLP. Our engineers made major contributions to projects such as Amazon Go and TensorFlow.
Work with top-flight software and hardware engineering talent from places like Google, Amazon, Nvidia, Palantir, and NASA JPL.
Own entire projects while working alongside cross-functional teams of doctors, designers, and operators.
Your work will directly contribute to saving and improving people’s lives. For real. :)
What We're Looking For
Impact - You’re deeply mission-driven and you think there’s more to life than software that enables puppy ears to be superimposed on photos. Although we concede those are cute.
Data Science - You have experience developing production software involving building data models for consumer or industrial applications. You are familiar with robust and scalable infrastructure for visualization and presentation.
Product passion - You care about the bits you ship ending up in users’ hands, and work backwards from user needs to come up with solutions to problems.
Entrepreneurship - You’re a self-starter who loves to own things end-to-end. You don’t ask for permission - you’re too busy making things happen.
Team player - You know how to make those around you better and feed off their energy. You take care of your teammates.
Curiosity - You like to prototype mobile apps based on the latest psychological research in habit formation in your free time? You open sourced your own neural network library? Boy have we got some fun things for you…
You have a BS, MS or PhD in computer science or a related field with focus on data science or machine learning.
WHY JOIN FORWARD?

We don’t want to just move dollars around the healthcare industry - we want to rebuild it and fix it. All of it. You’d be a major part of the story behind one of the most ambitious startup attempts of the past decade and you’d work with a team of people who want to use their talents for good.

We are an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. details:
Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and paper driver logs were common. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.

We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. 2-7+ years of relevant work experience

full_text: Senior Data Scientist, Stord, Atlanta, GA, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), +1 benefit, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 month ago, 4 applicants
details:
Stord is on a mission to make supply chain a competitive advantage for our customers. We’ve pioneered Cloud Supply Chain, which combines the all of the digital and physical elements of logistics that leading businesses need in a unified offering.

With Cloud Supply Chain, Stord is enabling companies to compete and grow with world-class logistics – including warehousing, freight and fulfillment – in a single, integrated platform that’s available exactly when and where they need it. Hundreds of B2B and B2C companies like Body Armor, Advanced AutoParts and Dollar General use Stord to make their supply chains perform with the speed, flexibility and ease of the cloud.

Our rapidly growing team is headquartered in the heart of Atlanta’s vibrant tech community and is led by former operators from Amazon, XPO, Ryder, Coyote, Convoy, and Manhattan Associates. Stord is backed by over $200M in funding from Kleiner Perkins, BOND, Founders Fund, D1 Capital, Salesforce Ventures, Susa Ventures, Lux Capital, and Lineage Logistics at a unicorn valuation of over $1.1 billion.

Come help us help businesses out-deliver their competition with Cloud Supply Chain.

A world class team is one in which all your colleagues are exceptional at what they do and are highly effective collaborators. The value and satisfaction of being on such a team is astounding. At Stord, we are laser focused on building a world class data science function.. and we are well on our way.

Our Senior Data Scientist will join a high caliber team within our Data Science division and will be responsible for building statistical and ML models to help automate and/ or optimize our robust chain functions. The successful candidate will have a passion for solving challenging problems and will have a wealth of experience using SQL and Python to develop, maintain, and deploy enterprise grade statistical and ML models in production.

What You’ll Do
Build, deploy, monitor, and maintain enterprise grade statistical and ML models and decisioning systems in production to help optimize/ automate business processes
Continuously monitor deployed models and experiment with different algorithms/ novel approaches to improve productionized systems’ performance
Partner closely with various internal customers (Freight, Fulfillment, Product, and Finance teams) to understand business requirements, providing feedback on feasibility, and implementing solutions that drive business performance
Collaborate with the data engineering team to identify ways to improve the quality of the cloud-based data warehouse
Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation to educate both internal and external customers about our systems
Manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from various sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques to identify gaps in the system and potential enhancements
Communicate verbally and in writing to key business stakeholders with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our systems, as well as sharing insights and recommendations
Acts as an advocate for continuous improvement, identifying opportunities and efficiencies to improve our existing systems and/ or MLOps process as a whole
What You'll Need
Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Operations Research or Economics
3+ years of relevant industry experience in an analytical role involving big data extraction, analysis, statistical/ ML modeling, and delivering advanced analytics solutions
Deep technical and data science expertise
Experience with core statistical analytical techniques, data mining, and predictive modeling is required (one or more of the following) :
regression analyses (linear regression, logistic regression, quantiles, etc.)
machine learning (neural networks, XGBoost, Random Forest, SVM, deep learning, etc.)
segmentation/ clustering techniques (K-means, etc.)
network analysis (location-allocation, travelling salesperson, vehicle routing problem)
Simulation (Monte Carlo, dynamic, discrete event)
Optimization (linear and nonlinear programming, heuristic)
time series analysis (ARIMA, VAR, etc.)
Graph theory (Breadth-first search, Depth-first search)
Recommender systems (collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, etc.)
Geographic cluster recognition and manipulation techniques
text mining & unstructured data analytics
Strong competency with big data analytics tools:
Languages (must have): Python, SQL
Libraries (must have expertise in at least one): TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras, Numpy, Theano, Keras, Pandas, Matplotlib
Cloud Ecosystems (must have expertise in at least one): GCP, AWS, Azure
Data Warehouses (must have expertise in at least one): BigQuery, Redshift, Synapse
SQL Databases (highly desirable): MySQL, Postgresql, Microsoft SQL Server
NoSQL Databases (highly desirable): MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Datastore
Analytics Platforms (nice to have): Databricks, Vertex AI, Dataiku, Alteryx, etc.
Data Visualization Tools (nice to have): Power BI, Sisense, Tableau, Lookr, Domo, etc.
Familiarity with MLOPs: Git branching, CI/CD/CT
Bonus Points
Preferably with a background in Supply Chain, Logistics, or Transportation
Culture Snapshot

Our team is passionate about sitting at the intersection of enterprise technology and global logistics. The Stord company culture is electric, and we are proud to offer a career experience that will make you excited to come to work every day. We are creating an environment of continuous improvement through collaboration and diverse thinking by solving challenging problems and working with talented and smart colleagues. At Stord you will have daily opportunities to learn and inspire those around you. You will be surrounded by a team of self-starters who are motivated to have an impact through driving results.

Below Are a Few Perks Of Joining Our Team
Competitive salary and bonus
Friendly, Passionate, and Intelligent Employee Base
Creative Problem Solving and Entrepreneurial Thinking
Fast-Paced Environment
Low-Ego, Solution-Driven Culture
Community Involvement and Volunteer Opportunities
Employee Resource Groups: Women of Stord, JEDI (Justice, Equity, Diversity, & Inclusion), Stord-Serves, & More
Benefits
401(k)
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
Life and Disability Insurance
Health Savings Account (HSA) option
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - Mental Health Resources
Paid Parental Leave
Gym Stipend
Flexible PTO
Paid holidays
And more!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

full_text: Principal Engineer, Machine Learning, Convoy Inc, Michigan, United States, On-site, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 2 weeks ago, 0 applicants
details:
Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and paper driver logs were common. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.

We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. We’ve also been backed by world-class investors, including Google, YCombinator, Fidelity, Greylock, Generation IM, Lone Pine, T. Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. We are proud to have been named a CNBC Disruptor 50 Winner (3x), a Fast Company World Changing Idea, a LinkedIn Top Startup, a Forbes' Best Startup Employer, one of Fortune Magazine's 'Impact 20' list, a best place to work in Washington State, a BloombergNEF Pioneer winner, and more.

This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help us transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste.

About the team:

Marketplace Demand drives the input to Convoy’s flywheel by bidding and pricing short and long-term freight opportunities. To achieve this goal, we predict the short and long-term costs of trucks, simulate network scenarios, understand Shipper needs and price sensitivities, while defining optimization objective functions, and managing ongoing yield of client relationships. This requires a high degree of product ML and forecasting capabilities, economic/ process innovation, and building a demand-side platform that aggregates opportunities from a wide range of bespoke shipper systems with high-data accuracy. Our cost forecasts are a key part of Convoy’s "secret sauce" and are critical inputs to a wide variety of other ML/ OR problems at Convoy. This includes supply side matching.

About you:

You will own a greenfield 0 to 1 platform and focus your work on the pricing system and forecasting engine that allows Convoy to operate profitably. Using ML, you will help define how the prediction on costs of servicing a given shipment and input for profit return by using ML. This system will power the rest of Convoy’s predictive systems. Ideal experience with pricing and marketplace systems & experience shipping platform (ML platform highly preferred). You will be working across multiple disciplines, including Engineering and Data Science. Our cost forecasts are a key part of Convoy’s secret recipe and are critical inputs to a wide variety of other ML problems at Convoy including supply-side matching.

You will:

Own a greenfield 0 to 1 platform, focusing on working on the pricing system & forecasting engine for Convoy to continue to operate profitably. Using ML, you will help define how the prediction on costs of servicing a given shipment and input for profit return by using ML. This system will power the rest of Convoy’s predictive systems. Ideal experience with pricing and marketplace systems & experience shipping platform (ML platform highly preferred). You will be working across multiple disciplines, including Engineering and Data Science.

We’re looking for someone who has:

Experience with a high degree of product machine learning and forecasting capabilities, process innovation, and building a demand-side platform that aggregates opportunities from a wide range of bespoke shipper systems with high data accuracy.

Benefits:

Employees' wellbeing is top of mind for the Convoy team. Outside of offering excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits, we also offer the following:
On demand mental and emotional health benefits through Lyra
On demand primary care through 98.6
Generous paid time off
Paid parental leave program
Fertility benefit solutions via Progyny
Child-care and adult/elder-care options through Bright Horizons
Opportunity to join and contribute to one of our Employee Resource Groups
Ability to make a real world impact!

Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

full_text: Senior Machine Learning Research Engineer, Alation, Redwood City, CA, On-site, Medical, +1 benefit, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 2 days ago
details:
Alation continues to hire for roles at various locations with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19 crisis.

Big Data isn’t a problem. It’s an opportunity.

At Alation, we help people find, understand, and trust data, so they not only excel in their work — they drive value for their enterprise, team and role. In the words of our customers, “Alation is our one-stop-shop for our data and analytics. It’s bringing people together to collaborate and solve our business problems.”

More than 400 enterprises drive data culture, improve decision making, and realize business outcomes with Alation, including AbbVie, Allianz Global Investors, American Family Insurance, Autozone, Cisco, Draft Kings, Exelon, Fifth Third Bank, Finnair, General Mills, Munich Re, NASDAQ, Parexel, Pfizer, Salesforce, Virgin Australia, and Vistaprint.

Headquartered in Silicon Valley, Alation is a 3X winner of Inc. Magazine’s Best Workplaces and is backed by leading venture capitalists including Blackstone, Costanoa, Data Collective, Dell Technologies, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Icon, ISAI Cap, Riverwood, Salesforce, Sanabil, Sapphire, and Snowflake Ventures. For more information, visit alation.com.

With more than $217M in funding - valued at $1.2 billion, Alation is poised to capitalize on data as an opportunity. Our exceptional Glassdoor ratings reflect a culture that makes coming to work each day a joy. Do you want to join a team that welcomes new ideas, supports your growth and recognizes your unique value?

Join us!

We are seeking an experienced machine learning engineer to join our highly strategic AI/ML research team. This team is tasked with researching and developing new, and extending existing, approaches using ML strategies driving customer value across many use cases. You will use current research to advance our product offerings, lead educational sessions for the broader Alation community, and interface with Alation engineering and product teams to build out new use cases that leverage AI/ML models from inception to productization. You will also be instrumental in helping us further enhance a work culture that fosters continuous learning and growth.

What You'll Do
Collaborate with engineering teams to develop new and improve existing AI/ML models supporting business use cases
Research and prototype new ML approaches and strategies relevant to Alation product offerings
Identify, qualify, and spearhead new machine learning use cases based on recent research
Act as a subject matter expert in all aspects of machine learning, and further the AI/ML expertise within the broader engineering organization
Stay current on the latest research and educate a broader internal audience
Grow and enhance Alation’s engineering culture and policies

You Should Have
CS, math, physics, or equivalent MS or higher degree with 5+ years of experience working as a machine learning engineer or researcher with strong python skills, including 3+ years of experience developing, testing, and deploying deep learning models (using TensorFlow or PyTorch)
A deep and broad understanding of machine learning algorithms, use cases, and implementations
Deep hands-on expertise of current NLP approaches
Solid knowledge and understanding of SQL
Experience with BI tools, headless BI, data transformation, and data modeling approaches
Very good communication and collaboration skills
Ability to translate research papers into product use cases that open or expand business opportunities

Nice To Have
Good understanding of MLOps processes and pipelines
Experience with architecting for and deploying ML models into Amazon Web Services using AWS SageMaker

More About Alation

Our founders have come together from different backgrounds: business, engineering, and design. This unique mix from our founding team is important to the Alation culture story. Today, our team consists of creators and communicators with varied backgrounds - from Stanford, to the Indian Institute of Technology, big companies and one-person startups, the United States, and abroad. We continue to seek ever more diverse perspectives as we grow.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on

the basis of race, name, religion, color, national origin, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Why Alation?
Market-Leading Data Catalog Provider
High-growth, collaborative environment with diverse and inclusive teams
Continuous learning, enrichment and development opportunities
Competitive pay and health offerings including commuter benefits
Flexible time off to relax and recharge

and much, much more!

full_text: Senior Analytics Engineer, Snyk, Boston, MA, Remote, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 5 days ago, 2 applicants
details:
All roles listed as ‘remote’ are available as remote within the same country.

Overview

We’re looking for a senior analytics engineer to join our new group to help us build the future of customer-facing data products at Snyk.

You’ll Spend Your Time
Building and maintaining the data mart that power our new customer-facing analytics product
Talking to our customers, making sure we’re building a product they truly love
Working across the stack to deliver new features from start-to-end
Deploying new features to production
Improving performance and overcoming scalability limits
Collaborating with your team, planning the most important projects to work on next
You Should Apply If You
Have experience in designing, building, and deploying high quality data products
Love working in a fast-paced start-up environment that respects its engineers and customers
Love building new products and getting innovative!
Have a good track record of project leadership and mentorship of software engineers
Ensure a high-quality of code, that can be safely co-authored in a fast growing organization
Feel comfortable working in a cross-functional team, working across the stack to deliver new features from start-to-end
Communicate proactively and have a team-first mind-set
We’d especially love to hear from you if you:
Have prior experience as an Analytics Engineer (or equivalent).
Exposure and expertise working with dbt.
Experience with SQL and git.
Experience optimizing data models against specific performance targets
Passion for building the best version of whatever you’re working on
A track record of working autonomously, with strong organizational and time management skills
A desire to continually keep up with advancements in data
Interested?

Please apply below! We care deeply about the warm, inclusive environment we’ve created and we value diversity - we welcome applications from those typically underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this role, but are not totally sure whether you’re the right person, do apply anyway :)

Location: EST Timezone, UK, or Remote (EST/UK)

About Snyk

Snyk’s mission is to help developers use open source code and stay secure.

The use of open source is booming, but security is a key concern (https://snyk.io/stateofossecurity/). Snyk’s unique product enables developers and enterprise security teams to continuously find & fix vulnerable dependencies without slowing down, offering seamless integration into Dev, DevOps and DevSecOps workflows. We care deeply about the quality and usefulness of the tools we develop, always focusing on our customers and users.

We are experiencing rapid growth - and we want you to join us! By the end of Q3 2019 alone, Snyk was already adopted by over 450,000 developers, and including multiple enterprise customers (such as Google, New Relic, ASOS and others). We also raised an additional $200 Million, announced on September 9, 2020, from investors such as Stripes and Salesforce Ventures, demonstrating that they are as excited as we are by Snyk’s progress and potential.

We believe open source software is a force for good, and we’re building Snyk to make it easier for developers who aren’t security experts to stay secure.

About Snyk

Snyk is the leader in developer security. We empower the world's developers to build secure applications and equip security teams to meet the demands of the digital world. Our developer-first approach ensures organizations can secure all of the critical components of their applications from code to cloud, leading to increased developer productivity, revenue growth, customer satisfaction, cost savings and an overall improved security posture.

At Snyk, we envision an inclusive technology industry powering a more sustainable and secure world. Since our founding, Snykers have cared deeply for one another and the developer and security communities as well as the larger world around us. Learn more about our Snyk Impact social and environmental mission and take action with us here.

Snyk's Developer Security Platform automatically integrates with a developer's workflow and is purpose-built for security teams to collaborate with their development teams. Snyk is used by 1,200 customers worldwide today, including industry leaders such as Asurion, Google, Intuit, MongoDB, New Relic, Revolut and Salesforce.

Snyk is recognized on the Forbes Cloud 100 2021, the 2021 CNBC Disruptor 50 and was named a Visionary in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for AST.

full_text: Senior Data Scientist (Financial Models), Intuitive, Sunnyvale, CA, On-site, Hide job, Your profile matches this job, 2 weeks ago
details:
Company Description

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare’s hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere—we strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture—our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let’s advance the world of minimally invasive care.

Job Description

Primary Function of Position:

The person will join our Data Science team, and in this role will interact directly with Intuitive’s CFO to test hypotheses and gain insights into business statistics and trends. Additionally, this person will provide their data science skillset to others in the Finance department as the CFO directs.

The Data Science team at Intuitive works with business partners across the company. Our work is very iterative, very collegial, and requires outstanding communication skills. It requires a personality that is inquisitive and collaborative, and it requires someone who can communicate exceptionally well with non-data-scientists, often explaining things like P values or residual variance or other concepts that an executive must understand to see the value of the work. This person needs to be unafraid to lead discussions, based on their command of the data available.

Roles & Responsibilities
With the CFO, jointly identify avenues of research and deliver statistically rigorous insights in a timely fashion.
Develop a close working relationship with the CFO and the members of the Data Science team. Become a trusted and vital partner to the CFO.
Present and discuss findings to Finance and Sales leadership in a collaborative, iterative and sometimes unscripted environment, as well in more formal settings.
Deeply understand the customer journey for our varied customers. Understand the sale of $2M+ surgical systems, and of the consumables that work with them; understand the partnership between Intuitive Surgical and a surgeon as that surgeon decides to adopt the technology.
Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Finance, and various other teams for cross domain analytics.
Build data foundations and develop models that attempt to explain, for example, variance in the adoption of Intuitive technology. Collaborate with (and sometimes guide) the CFO in developing testable hypotheses.
Develop statistically driven insights therefrom, that give finance leadership and others potent insights by which they better understand factors affecting our business, and from which they may modify their processes.
Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to measure process effectiveness.
Create and automate powerful yet digestible visualizations to enable unaided consumption by business partners.
Build and help operationalize predictive models for internal use.
Identify gaps in data capture or data quality, and surface the value attached to filling those gaps.
Collaborate with fellow data scientists on our team.
Qualifications

Skills, Experience, Education, & Training:
Demonstrated ability to trust, and to be trusted. Unimpeachable character.
Demonstrated ability to think analytically and use sound judgment; capability to build solutions and solve problems while displaying excellent critical thinking.
Outstanding communication skills, both oral and written, appropriate for engaging deeply with our CFO and other executives, including presentation skills.
Ability to explain complicated statistical and data science concepts and metrics to executives and other non-data-scientists.
A personality that can handle engagement with top executives at a ten-thousand-person company. An ability to be succinct, and to summarize at the appropriate level. Knowledge and tact to contribute effectively to executive-level meetings.
Demonstrated track record of intellectual curiosity and initiative. Willingness and ability to provide guidance to business partners to “get to the testable hypothesis”. Demonstrated track record of “looking under rocks” and analyzing data in novel ways to get to hidden insights. A penchant for asking why, over and over again. A sense of wonder combined with the chops to get to the answer.
An interest and capacity to quickly learn the business of medical robotics through immersion in financial, clinical, and technical training – an interest and desire to learn this space are a must.
A natural affinity towards collaboration, and a willingness to do whatever it takes to solve the problem.
Strong knowledge of data science concepts (predictive modeling, regression analysis, control groups, etc.) applied to business problems. Strong knowledge of statistical methods and applications. Ability to understand cohort analysis beyond “averages”.
Proficiency with programming and data mining/visualization tools such as R, Python, Tableau, SQL, SAP HANA SQL, SAS/JMP, or SPSS. Tableau experience is strongly desired. Accuracy and attention to detail are essential.
Proven experience gaining command of rich and varied datasets, including incomplete or messy data, while making solutions repeatable and defensible.
Strong organizational skills. Ability to meet deadlines in a changing environment and perform multiple tasks effectively and concurrently. Self-management is important.
Ability to help choose, with the CFO, the balance between thoroughness and timeliness depending on external constraints.
Ability to assist in growing a small team over time, as needs warrant, to serve Finance more deeply.
Desired: A background in healthcare and familiarity with the business of surgery, specifically background in the surgical equipment sales process (large capital and/or consumables).
Desired: Experience or desire to eventually manage a small team of data scientists (beginning with a single direct report).
Desired: Familiarity with data generated by SalesForce.com.
Possession of a master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Data Science, or a related field with 3+ years in a similar role, or a bachelor’s degree with 5+ years.
Desire to make work fun.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Shift : Day

Travel : 10% of the time

JOB1114

full_text: Senior Data Scientist - Product (Remote), Hinge Health, Minneapolis, MN, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), +1 benefit, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 1 week ago
details:
Hinge Health is building the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. It is now the leading Digital MSK Clinic, used by four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches.

Hinge Health’s HingeConnect integrates with 750,000+ in-person providers and enables real-time interventions for elective MSK surgeries, driving proven medical claims reduction. Available to millions of members, Hinge Health is widely trusted by leading organizations, including Land O’Lakes, L.L. Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon.

To Learn more about our company & culture please visit:

http://www.hingehealth.com & https://www.hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion/

You’ll play a key role in analyzing data generated by our users as well as providing insights for a wide variety of internal teams (Product, Growth, Clinical, Commercial, Finance, Research) and large enterprise customers. You will be a highly-visible, trusted partner to many of our most important decision makers. This is a fantastic opportunity to join our fast-growing Data team and shape how Hinge Health puts its data to use.

What You'll Accomplish
Spearheading analysis and reporting with SQL/Python and interactive dashboards
Working across departments to standardize how our company runs business and product analysis
Building out our data dictionary and setting up aggregated views of our datasets
What We're Looking For
Experience in analytics with a focus on operational reporting (KPIs) and cross-functional analysis
Can take an analysis from stakeholder request, to an ad hoc query, to a high-caliber dashboard in hours
Adept at working with data engineers to set company-wide standards for our datasets, helping create a single source of truth for all analytics
Strong communication skills and patience when working with multiple stakeholders simultaneously
SQL experience required; Python a nice-to-have
Prior experience with BI/visualization tools (Tableau, Mode Analytics, Looker, etc.) a must
A high attention to detail and the ability to QA data at a glance or in depth
Ability to work autonomously and with minimal guidance
What You'll Love About Us
Competitive compensation with meaningful equity
Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance (We cover 100% of your premium and 75% for your dependents)
Flexible PTO
FSA/HSA accounts
Family & fertility benefit through Maven Clinic
401K match
3 months paid parental leave
Professional Development budget
Quarterly lifestyle benefit to use towards WFH equipment & fitness
Generous mental health stipend
Work from home policy
Opportunity to join a fantastically talented, diverse, and passionate team at a pivotal time in the company’s lifecycle
Pursuant to State Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in the following locations:

Colorado & New York State annual salary: $103,656 - $155,484

New York City annual salary: $123,400 - $185,100

Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.

If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center.

If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com.

If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you. No recruiters, please.

Hinge Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Hinge Health is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know by reaching out to your Recruiter and we'll work with our accommodations team to evaluate your request.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

position: Analytics Engineer, Google Cloud Solution Engineering
full_text: Analytics Engineer, Google Cloud Solution Engineering, Google, Atlanta, GA, Hide job, 141 company alumni work here, 2 weeks ago
details:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Atlanta, GA, USA; Austin, TX, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Seattle, WA, USA.

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or Data Engineering, or equivalent practical experience
5 years of experience designing and implementing data/analytics solutions based on cloud architectures and technologies
5 years of experience in client facing or technical consulting engagements including full-lifecycle data, and analytics solutions design and delivery

Preferred qualifications:
Google Cloud Data Engineer certification or cloud data architect equivalent experience
5 years of experience working with SQL for Analysis, and scripting for data engineering or statistics
5 years of experience with SAP or other enterprise applications that include functional and technical knowledge of the application data models and data domains
2 years experience with Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, and related technologies
Experience with creating client-facing assets and technical documentation including architecture diagrams and design documents and specifications
Experience with 2-3 analytics platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik, or similar, including modeling data structures, aggregates, calculations, filters, etc.

About The Job

Analytics Engineers are part of a dedicated team focused on engineering solutions and accelerators to support differentiation of Google Cloud with the enterprise customer base. As an Analytics Engineer, you will design, build, and extend data and analytics accelerator solutions templates and content for the enterprise business with Google Cloud. You will be part of a team dedicated to driving and advancing our portfolio of data and analytics solutions from Google Cloud and those of our Independent Software Vendor (ISV) partners. You will be knowledgeable of industry and technology trends, and emerging technologies.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with solution managers, engineers, cross-functional stakeholders, system integrators, and Independent Software Vendor (ISV) partners to understand requirements, and design and engineer creative analytics visualization solutions.
Develop and enhance data and analytics solutions and accelerators we are delivering to the market based on learnings from customer and partner engagements.
Contribute to the overall strategy and direction of the data and analytics solution design and framework by which new enterprise data solutions will be developed and/or extended.
Provide subject matter expertise in analytics and reporting for various enterprise data domains such as SAP or other equivalent (e.g. Salesforce, Oracle, Workday, etc.).

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

full_text: Associate Data Scientist, Hedgeye Risk Management, LLC, Stamford, CT, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 month ago, 13 applicants
details:
Partnering closely with Hedgeye’s marketing team, you will serve as the lead for all analytics efforts designed to advance our portfolio/campaign monitoring, reporting, emergent trend detection, and growth hacking capabilities
Independently lead the firm in evaluating, selecting, implementing, and training users on a self-service dashboarding solution
Assist Hedgeye’s product group in providing timely, high-quality research with quantitative analyses that enhance analysts’ financial models and with automations to accelerate our speed to market
Develop complex, dynamic SQL queries for production use
Collaborate closely with our Operations team on database design, data pipelines, and infrastructure selection to support internal and external analytics applications
Work closely with business partners and management to define requirements and build/deploy remarkable, interactive dashboards and reports that provide users with real-time insights and the power to drill down, through, up and around their data
Design, pitch, and win buy-in for testing new marketing ideas and experimental interventions in our customer lifecycle management operations; partner with the business to run these experiments; present findings to stakeholders; and deploy the successes at scale in our production processes
Ability to work independently; teach yourself new technologies, figure things out on your own, and to know when to ask for help
Strong proficiency with SQL (any flavor), RDBMS, relational database design, query writing for production applications, ETL pipelines, and stored procedures
Familiarity with at least one SQL IDE for query development
Experience working with disparate data sources lacking documentation and the ability to determine data design/generation process through inspection, reasoning, and testing
Experience developing BI dashboards to monitor business KPIs with at least one modern dashboarding solution (Google Data Studio, Looker, Domo, Tableau, Power BI, Snowflake, etc.)
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or other STEM program; or equivalent informal education (e.g. through self-study, independent projects, work experience)
0-3 years’ work experience in a related role
Familiarity with at least one general purpose programming language (R or python preferred) a plus
Exposure to digital marketing analytics and Salesforce/Pardot platforms is a plus

full_text: Senior/Lead/Principal Data Engineer, Salesforce, Austin, TX, Remote, Hide job, 1 connection works here, 1 week ago, 3 applicants
details:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category Products and Technology Job Details
If you are currently in college/ grad school or have less than 2 years of experience - please check out FutureForce job opportunities at Salesforce:
https://www.salesforce.com/company/careers/university-recruiting/

Open to Fully Remote, Flex (1-3 days/week in the office), or Office-Based (4-5 days/week in office)

Data Intelligence (Di) is the force that propels Salesforce into the 4th Industrial Revolution informing through trusted data and artificial intelligence the path forward to be smarter in every dimension. From financial forecasting, customer health, adoption insights to the utmost trusted and curated data, the Data Intelligence team is the unbiased partner to all data trailblazers at Salesforce.

Interesting Articles About Some Of Our Work

Lessons in Building: What Salesforce Had to Learn About Forecasting After Missing Internal Sales Goals

How AI Is Transforming Forecasting for the Better

How Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff uses artificial intelligence to end internal politics at meetings

Marc Benioff brings an A.I. machine called Einstein to his weekly staff meeting

Team Overview

The Data Science and Engineering team enables various data personas with robust and scalable frameworks, services and brings data to life. We partner with data producers and platform engineers to empower data engineers and data consumers (data scientists, data analysts and Business Intelligence engineers) with data, services and APIs for data science applications, data products and business analytics. We pride ourselves in being data curious (one who has an intrinsic need to understand a data point) and passionate about improving reliability and throughput of analytics and machine learning solutions at Salesforce. We are a globally distributed inclusive team that builds and relies on trust, constantly innovate and work towards one common theme - Customer Success.

As a Data Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for having insight into overall enterprise data ecosystem and ensuring that it meets the requirements for data needs from across the business.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with data, security & platform teams to outline modern data integration techniques & process using cloud technologies.
Define how data will be collected, stored, consumed & managed.
Drive data access methods & architect data services to improve the overall efficiency of data availability & accessibility for analytics.
Oversee the development, management and monitoring of data pipelines.
Ensure compliance with governing standards, data quality & protection principles.
Provide technical guidance and oversight to help establish consistent adoption of technical design across all data onboarding initiatives.
If You Are
Leader: Excellent solution design skills, Inspire and enable distributed teams of senior engineers.
Experienced Professional:
Expertise in big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Presto, Hive, Snowflake etc...
Strong coding skills in Python/Java/Scala or equivalent
Good knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
Solid understanding of engineering and data platform best practices.
Understanding of scalability and reliability concerns for data-intensive applications
Innovative: Can connect the dots & have that unique viewpoint to solve problems.
Collaborative & Communicative:
Exceptional communication skills, and articulate technical concepts into easy-to-understand language for business partners.
We love to brainstorm together!
Preferred:
Prior experience with building end-to-end Machine Learning pipelines.
Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS or GCP.
Prior experience with docker and Kubernetes.
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $98,900. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/

Benefits & Perks

We have a public-facing website https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/en that explains our various benefits, including wellbeing reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more. Visit for the full breakdown!

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .

Salesforce welcomes all.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

full_text: Research Scientist - Talent Network, Convoy Inc, Seattle, WA, On-site, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 connection works here, 4 days ago, 3 applicants
details:
Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and paper driver logs were common. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.

We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. We’ve also been backed by world-class investors, including Google, YCombinator, Fidelity, Greylock, Generation IM, Lone Pine, T. Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. We are proud to have been named a CNBC Disruptor 50 Winner (3x), a Fast Company World Changing Idea, a LinkedIn Top Startup, a Forbes' Best Startup Employer, one of Fortune Magazine's 'Impact 20' list, a best place to work in Washington State, a BloombergNEF Pioneer winner, and more.

This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help us transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste.

Thanks for trucking on over! We are working to fill our business critical roles at this time so we may not have your exact position open. We don’t want that to stop you from sharing your information with us for future roles though!

Please feel free to submit your resume and contact information through this application. We hope to reach out to you in the near future when we have a position that aligns with your background.

About the team:

Research Science is at the core of Convoy’s platforms. We build the models that power freight pricing, shipment offer relevance, auction bidding strategy, and other core services. We also forecast business metrics, evaluate the causal impact of business decisions, design statistical and machine learning models to optimize our product, and leverage our data to generate insights for our customers. The breadth of the problems space is huge, spanning machine learning, optimization, causal inference, experimental design, econometrics, and prediction domains. We have only begun to dig into the difficult and diverse problems in our two-sided marketplace.

You will:
Leverage machine learning and optimization to automate and improve decision making in our core problem areas
Develop and deploy new solutions and improving existing machine learning models (including deep learning, reinforcement learning and tree based methods)
Design and implement scalable automated decisioning systems
Lead research initiatives to drive actionable learnings and ultimately impact for Convoy
Work on systems that automate our dynamic freight marketplace

We’re looking for someone who has:
Minimum of 2-7+ years of experience developing machine learning solutions
PhD or MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math/OR, Engineering, or related quantitative field.
Experience using Python and SQL for deploying and maintaining models in production
Experience with machine learning and deep learning toolkits and frameworks
Ability to frame business problems as automated decision solutions
Intelligent but practical; you want to get things done and love simplicity
